description: Erection of new timber shopfront and signage
decision_conditions: <p><span style="text-align: justify; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">The proposed shopfront alterations and signage, by reason of its scale, positioning and detailed design, would comprise an overly prominent and&nbsp; unsympathetic addition, to the detriment of the character and appearance of the application site and wider terrace. As such the proposed development is contrary to policy D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach), D4 (Delivering Good Design) and D8 (Public Realm) of the London Plan 2021, policy </span><span style="text-align: justify; background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">PP1 (Public Realm), </span><span style="text-align: justify; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">policy LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character) of the Local Plan 2033 and the guidance contained within Hackney Shop Front Design Guide</span></p>
